entry.title: Germany Training or Florida Rails Conference?
entry.content:
Two things to blog to you aboutâ€¦

Firstly, if you work near Munich or Frankfurt, Germany and your company might be interested in having me do some Rails training at the end of the month, Iâ€™m going to be there for a conference and would love to talk to you. The dates Iâ€™m looking at are January 28 or 29. Email me at Gregg at Rails Envy.

Secondly, if you live in the South East US or youâ€™re just looking to get away from the winter weather, itâ€™s not too late to get tickets to Acts As Conference, Orlando Floridaâ€™s yearly Rails conference taking place February 6th and 7th. Orlando is simply beautiful this time of year, and the conference is pretty close to Disney/Universal so you have no excuse not to bring the whole family! Then again, if youâ€™re too busy making snow angels, Iâ€™ll understand.

Jason and I will be speaking there along with a great lineup of speakers including Yehuda Katz doing his first post Rails + Merb Merge talk, Steven Bristol talking about how to make Successful Rails apps, Bryan Liles is continuing his â€˜Test all the fâ€™n timeâ€™ mantra, and Orlandoâ€™s own Tim Rosenblatt talking about using OAuth with Rails.

Should be a great time, so if youâ€™re looking for a way to get out of the snow and into the sun, this may be your best bet. Hopefully see you there!
